abstract: Even as new economic reports signal that China’s economy is slowing, Beijing continues to resist a large stimulus package.
snippet: Even as new economic reports signal that China’s economy is slowing, Beijing continues to resist a large stimulus package.
lead_paragraph: Beijing continues to resist a new large fiscal stimulus package, despite a report last week that the nation’s manufacturing sector had contracted in July at its fastest pace since last summer. Instead, the government announced a “mini stimulus” that included a tax cut for small companies, a reduction of red tape and costs for exporters, and the opening of investment in railroad construction to private capital.

headline.main: China Opts for Only Small Steps to Stimulate Economy

abstract: China’s investigation into accusations that the British pharmaceutical company GlaxoSmithKline bribed doctors and public officials to increase its sales contrasts with the approach by the United States authorities in such cases.
snippet: China’s investigation into accusations that the British pharmaceutical company GlaxoSmithKline bribed doctors and public officials to increase its sales contrasts with the approach by the United States authorities in such cases.
lead_paragraph: In advertising, the adage is that “sex sells.” In the world of white-collar crime, it is rare that there is anything other than money at stake, but the continuing corruption investigation in China into the British pharmaceutical company GlaxoSmithKline now has a dash of the libido to draw even more attention.

headline.main: Lessons From the Glaxo Case in China

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China
